meanings.sent1: The mischance of dropping her phone in the pool ruined her day.
meanings.sent2: It was a mischance that he forgot his umbrella on such a rainy day.
meanings.sent3: The mischance of wearing mismatched socks made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her mischance in choosing the wrong bus led her to a new adventure.
meanings.sent5: The mischance of spilling coffee on her white shirt was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: Bad luck or an unlucky occurrence.
meanings.sent1: He believed his mischance with lottery tickets would change one day.
meanings.sent2: The team's mischance in losing the game was disappointing.
meanings.sent3: Her mischance with always picking the longest line at the store was comical.
meanings.sent4: The mischance of missing the train felt like a sign to slow down.
meanings.sent5: Their mischance with the weather made the picnic unforgettable.
